author: Wild West

text: Not counting Ogre Battle 64 since it's the same series, the closest I can think of is Soul Nomad for the PS2. It's a tactical RPG that's sort of similar in that your units consist of small parties rather than individuals, each with an assigned leader and their actions in battle play out randomly based on formation. However, the tactical part of combat plays out in a traditional turn-based fashion on a grid, and unit leaders can learn spells and abilities that can be used in addition to simply attacking. Mission objectives are also more traditional, but the game has some other interesting mechanics such as units having passive abilities depending on the "room" they're placed into, some branching paths, and items that have various effects like attacking townspeople.

author: Sheela

text: One of my absolute favourite games to the SNES! :) The strategic decisions, the tactical battles and the large maps with hidden details and subplots were all amazing, but to be such a detailed game and also revolving around such an incredibly awesome story... it was, for the lack of a better term, complete. No bullshit DLCs that were needed for certain stories to be resolved. On top of that.. 13 possible endings based on if you were good or evil or kind of good or kind of evil or... gaah!! XD
